metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3660 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
parser.c in libxml2 before 2.9.2 does not properly prevent entity expansion even when entity substitution has been disabled, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a crafted XML document containing a large number of nested entity references, a variant of the "billion laughs" attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3660` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.4
libxml2-utils - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.4
python-libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.4').
